title: Schema definition for extra_config of endpoints

max_rate.title: Max rate
max_rate.description:
Sets the number of maximum requests the endpoint can handle per second. The absence of max_rate in the configuration or 0 is the equivalent to no limitation.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/rate-limit/

client_max_rate.title: Client max rate
client_max_rate.description:
Number of requests per second this endpoint will accept for each user (user quota). The client is defined by the 'strategy' field. The client_max_rate keeps a counter for every client and endpoint.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/rate-limit/

strategy.title: Strategy
strategy.description:
The strategy you will use to set client counters. One of ip or header. Only to be used in combination with client_max_rate.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/rate-limit/

key.title: Key
key.description:
The header key containing the unique user identification or IP

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/rate-limit/

combiner.title: Custom combiner
combiner.description: For custom builds of KrakenD only

sequential.title: Sequential proxy
sequential.description:
The sequential proxy allows you to chain backend requests, making calls dependent one of each other.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/sequential-proxy/

static.title: Static response
static.description:
The static proxy injects static data in the final response when the selected strategy matches.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/static-proxy/

data.title: Data
data.description:
The static data (as a JSON object) that you will return.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/static-proxy/

strategy.title: Strategy
strategy.description:
One of the supported strategies

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/static-proxy/

validation/json-schema.title: Validating the body with the JSON Schema
validation/json-schema.description:
apply automatic validations using the JSON Schema vocabulary before the content passes to the backends. The json schema component allows you to define validation rules on the body, type definition, or even validate the fields' values.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/json-schema/

auth/api-keys.title: API-key validation
auth/api-keys.description:
Enterprise only. Validates that users of this endpoint pass a valid API-key containing one of the declared roles.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/authentication/api-keys/
